Support From the World Not From Churches.-- Constant work is to be done for the outcasts, but this work is not to be made all-absorbing. . . . No one should now visit our churches and in the present 
                                                                           260
pressure obtain from them means to sustain the work of rescuing outcasts. The means to sustain that work should come, and will come, largely from those not of our faith. Let the churches take up their appointed work of presenting truth from the oracles of God in the highways.--Letter 138, 1898.
